channel.description: Recent content in Open Bounties on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Data processing and visual infographics (through DuckDB-WASM)
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)

item.title: Realtime memory knowledge updates (RAG updates)
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Implement a memory storage system Allow realtime context updates for the LLM Refresh the context and LLM knowledge in realtime Add to cycle fine-tuning

item.title: Self-host AI model on the browser
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)

item.title: $icy utility commands
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: ?icy accounting –> smod command or above + head channel only current fund in contract icy in market offset usd unpaid salary advance ?icy –> show info address conversion rate fund in contract how many you have earned last 5 tx

item.title: Rework Fortress Command
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: remove: ?event ?staff ?updates rework UI & function (mostly move to note.d) ?digest ?memos ?earn

item.title: Applying MPC for authentication for web3 Console
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Use Multi-Party Computation for secure authentication in a Web3 console environment: Research and implement MPC protocols suitable for authentication. Integrate MPC into the Console app for secure user authentication

item.title: Demo: Biometrics on the web (through external device connection)
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Implement biometric authentication for web applications via external devices: Research and select appropriate biometric hardware compatible with web applications. Develop a secure method for connecting and communicating with the external device. Integrate biometric authentication into the web authentication flow.

item.title: Demo: Magic Links
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Implement a ‘Magic Link’ system for passwordless authentication: Develop an email-based authentication system where users receive a unique, time-sensitive link to log in. Ensure the security of the magic link generation and verification process.

item.title: Demo: QR Code based Login
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Create a QR code-based login system for easy and secure access to web applications: Design the QR code generation and scanning process. Implement a secure system for QR code validation and user authentication.

item.title: Implement a rust game through WASM
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Design a simple game concept suitable for implementation in Rust. Develop the game logic and user interface in Rust. Compile and optimize the Rust code for WASM. Test game performance and compatibility across various browsers.

item.title: Implementing a game server on Rust
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Develop a robust and efficient game server using Rust. Design the server architecture with a focus on scalability and performance. Implement core server functionalities like player management, real-time communication, and game logic. Test for concurrency and load handling.

item.title: Fortress Mma Score
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Update fortress database Create a new table employee_mma_scores including (but not limited): employee_id mastery_score autonomy_score meaning_score rated_at Create a Discord command ?profile @member (smod or above perm) data: latest mma score, basic info, project info design: add later (hnh) 2.1 Specific Channel Permission Create a scoped channel, same as scoped role permission this command only run in defined channels Discord command to export a template csv ?mma template (smod or above perm)

item.title: Fortress Shanky Data
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: generate & render something as above with following syntax data: source | amount | target sample: Wages [1500] Budget Other [250] Budget Budget [450] Taxes Budget [420] Housing Budget [400] Food Budget [295] Transportation Budget [25] Savings note: hnh i will provide a db view for data queries https://sankeydiagram.net

item.title: Trend Command
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Requirements ?trend command The idea is to create a ?trend Discord command that will list the top 15 trending repositories on GitHub. We can reference https://github.com/trending to make our list. Otherwise, we will need to identify what should count as trending on our end (stars/day, commits/day, etc). There are no particular design requirements for this command, but it should use an embed and look similar to the outputs of our other commands.
